committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Crime and Criminal Justice

official_title: To prohibit the transportation in interstate commerce or from any foreign country into the United States of services provided by convicts or prisoners, and for other purposes.
short_title: Convict Service Labor Prohibition Act of 1992

summary.text: Convict Service Labor Prohibition Act of 1992 - Amends Federal law to establish penalties and fines for persons who knowingly transport in interstate commerce or import from a foreign country goods on which services are performed wholly or in part by convicts or prisoners. Requires all packages containing such goods to be clearly marked with certain content information. Amends the Tariff Act of 1930 to prohibit the importation of such goods. Sets forth civil penalties for violation of such prohibition.

titles.title: Convict Service Labor Prohibition Act of 1992
To prohibit the transportation in interstate commerce or from any foreign country into the United States of services provided by convicts or prisoners, and for other purposes.
